Package frechetDistance

Class Polygon

java.lang.Object
frechetDistance.Polygon
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeographicPolygon
public class Polygon
extends java.lang.Object
Multidimensional polygon implementation.

This implementation is based on a double[][] containing the coordinates of the polygons vertices.

Author:
Anton Ballmaier

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private double[][] data  
    int dimension
    The dimensionality of each vertex of the polygon.
    int length
    The number of vertices of the polygon.

    Calculates the euclidean distance between to multidimensional points a and b.

  • Field Details

    • dimension

      public final int dimension
      The dimensionality of each vertex of the polygon.

    • length

      public final int length
      The number of vertices of the polygon.

    • data

      private final double[][] data

  • Constructor Details

    • Polygon

      public Polygon​(double[][] data)
      Constructs a new Polygon object using the given data. The given double[][] is not copied but simply referenced in the new Polygon. Therefore the user must make sure the given array isn't altered.
      Parameters:
      data - the vertices of the polygon. data[i][j] is interpreted as the jth coordinate of the ith vertex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data contains less than two vertices
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data contains null as one of it's vertices
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given data contains vertices of different dimensionality

  • Method Details

    • cornerDistance

      public double cornerDistance​(Polygon p, int ownIndex, int pIndex)
      Calculates the distance between specified vertices of this and another Polygon. It must be ensured that the given indices are valid for the respective Polygon.
      Parameters:
      p - the other polygon
      ownIndex - the index of the vertex of this
      pIndex - the index of the vertex of p
      Returns:
      the euclidean distance between the specified vertices
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given polygon has a different dimensionality than this

    • getVertex

      public double[] getVertex​(int i)
      Returns the selected vertex. Note that changing the returned array will result in changing the Polygons data!
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the selected vertex.
      Returns:
      the copy of the selected vertex.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the given index isn't viable

    • longestSegment

      public double longestSegment()
      Calculates the length of the longest segment (a segment being the line between two consecutive vertices)
      Returns:
      the length of the longest segment

    • euclideanDistance

      private double euclideanDistance​(double[] a, double[] b)
      Calculates the euclidean distance between to multidimensional points a and b.
      Parameters:
      a - the first point
      b - the second point
      Returns:
      the euclidean distance of a and b
